author: Thomas
references: Buchspiess et al., 2011. Life Cycle Assessment of high sea fish vs salmon aquaculture - vielestudien. ESU Services. Page 12 text and fig. 4.3
name: Kabeljau
co2-calculation: directly from source 5.3kg CO2eq/kg frozen cod, estimate from figure 4.3 page 12 around 0.7 kg CO2-eq/kg are from the storage & distribution -> 5.3 -0.7
other-references: 1. Blonk et al. 2008 Milieueffecten van Nederlandse consumptie van eiwitrijke producten. Blonk Milieu Advies in opdracht van VROM -> page 24, table 3.3 =  3.4 kg CO2/kg, not sure if the CO2-end value is on filet or on the complete fish.
info-text: Three types of fisheries in Denmark: 1. industrial fishery for fish meal and oil 2. pelagic fishery for human consumption; mainly hering and mackerel stored in tanks and landed whole 3. demersal fishery for white fish (cod, hake, haddock, whiting, saithe), flatfish, lobster and deep water prawns
calculation-process-documentation:
fishing till retail
deep frozen is still included

Fishing on Northeast Atlantic sea, harbour in Denmark. Deep frozen. Representative for the demersal fishery industry. Fish to fillet factor 0.41
comments: Deep frozen still included, fish filet
